Guatemala Water Project

Chichimuch, Guatemala

The Chichimuch Water Supply Project aims to find good water source and construct a sustainable water distribution system in the community of Chichimuch to help alleviate their water scarcity problem. Chichimuch has plentiful water during wet season, but very limited water access in dry season, which lasts around 6 months. Now, a potential water source has been found and is under analysis for quality, quantity, and feasibility as the source for the new system.

The water filtration project in Socorro, Guatemala is a success with over 1000 biosand filters implemented in households in ten communities within the region. A substantial improvement of health condition of the residents from these regions was observed after the implementation of the filters and the NGO is working with more communities to bring in to the biosand filters to improve drinking water quality.

Blog

PVC Pipes

26 Mar 2015

Joe is pictured above setting up the PVC pipe to allow us to determine the amount of water that could be provided by the potential new source. We had to clear away sediment and even use a glove to prevent water from seeping through the mini-dam we built. We recorded the time it took to fill a Nalgene bottle to calculate the flow rate.



Water Testing

25 Mar 2015

The above picture shows the water quality testing procedure. The water samples from various sources were stored in plastic tubes until they were ready for testing. The second picture above shows the coliform and e-coli counting procedure. After an incubation period we counted the number of colonies present in each plate.



Local School in Chichimuch

24 Mar 2015

Today our team visited the local school in Chichimuch. During our visit we ran tests on the filters in the school and gave a presentation to some of the kids. In this picture you can see the team showing one of the classes a short animation in Spanish about sanitation and hygiene. This animation was created by a University of Illinois organization called SAWBO (Scientific Animations Without Borders) that makes various free animations with numerous translations of local languages.
